title: Who will Trump choose for Treasury Secretary? And some key lessons in polymarkets

body.raw:
Premises: 
- specific scoop articles from Axios 75% correct in their in/out shortlist assumptions

- other articles about who is in the runnning are broadly correct

- Trump meets with final candidates

- Trump wants someone on his team who will pursue tariffs on imports while not roiling stock markets. This is the primary divide in candidates.


Study: 

The most accurate (75% odds) statement on the race is the following scoop article
https://www.axios.com/2024/11/20/trump-treasury-secretary-hagerty-warsh-rowan

> Scott Bessent, a hedge-fund manager who was another finalist for Treasury, looks to be in a derby for the consolation prize of director of Trump's National Economic Council.

Quote indicates Bessent is out of the running.
---
Trump meets with Marc Rowan and Kevin Warsh
https://www.bloomberg.com/news/videos/2024-11-21/trump-meets-rowan-warsh-in-treasury-secretary-search-video

---
Polymarket is trading at 50/50 for Bessent now ?? Could be insiders.

Newer articles suggest otherwise
---
NYPOST  is saying that it's down to Rowan and Bessent
https://nypost.com/2024/11/20/us-news/donald-trump-transition-news-11-20-2024/


Two sources close to President-elect Donald Trump insist that Scott Bessent, founder of Key Square Group investment firm, is still out in front and the other names being floated are merely a “smokescreen.”

A third source says the race is between Rowan and Bessent, but it was unclear who had the advantage.

Bessent was spotted at Mar-a-Lago Wednesday evening; however, it's unclear whether that was for his own job interview.

The Post understands the Trump team is hoping to announce their picks for all the big cabinet posts by the end of this week.


---

I might sell my other picks.

update: sold Bessent Nos, sold Warsh YES

Looks like Bloomberg missed that Bessent was at Mar-a-Lago on Wednesday. WTF?
---

Ok, so, apparently, contrary to Axios' article, Bessent is still in the running. NYPOST is saying he's a frontrunner, while FT is saying it's a toss up between
Rowan and Bessent.

Bessent is not well known, but he is connected to Trump. He can deliver on tariffs but spook the market.
Rowan doesn't spook markets but ruins the populist vibe a bit. He is the Jewish PE pick. Harms populist aspects of the campaign.

---
I'm going 3:1 Rowan. I don't like Bessent, Trump has had many conversations with Rowan atp and he is the most qualified.

My thesis is that Rowan can excite the markets the most, which Trump likes

>Rowan has the support of several Trump confidants and Wall Street donors, who cited his deep experience in financial markets.
technically haggerty), rowan and warsh have been interviewed
last stages
imo the thesis is that although warsh will calm markets, their differences are irreconcilable
rowan would give a more glazing yet head-on-shoulders attitude and pump the stock market given his exp
if trump doesnt care abt establishment then warsh wins
FINALISTS PER AXIOS: Hagerty, along with former Fed governor Kevin Warsh and Apollo CEO Marc Rowan.
